programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers visit Moreno Valley, where Casey and Rene acquire the perfect locker and Darrell's plans go badly wrong.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Ton and Allen are in Nashville, Tennessee, where they meet a band of tough, high-bidding bikers before discovering a 37mm anti-tank gun and a cowboy's rodeo saddle.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Big Sis reveals bad news as the guys clash with Carolyn over a carnival unit at an auction. Meanwhile, Ton and Allen unearth a Native American tomahawk.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: The Good, the Bad and the Hungry
programme.desc: A locker belonging to a deceased tycoon goes up for auction, and all the bidders are determined to get their hands on its contents.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders attend an auction in Burelson, where they set out to find items of value among huge truckloads of strange oddities.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank head to Minnesota and challenge Danielle to sell a fibreglass cowboy boot they bought more than a year previously.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: A new hunting season begins, but this time the swampers are faced with some of the biggest alligators seen in the area for years.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: Jamie's team springs into action when a trailer of pharmaceuticals runs into a block of ice, and there's further chaos when a truckload of chickens crashes.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers get the opportunity to buy one of the quietest aircraft ever made. They also consider purchasing a famous casino chip called 'the one arm bandit' and a signed New York Yankees jersey.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers get the opportunity to purchase a Grammy trophy and a rare 1930s cola cooler. Later, a couple bring along a rickshaw that used to carry tigers in the Siegfried & Roy stage show.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts make surprising discoveries as they explore the ancient past for evidence of alien overseers.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: History's greatest geniuses have often said their ideas came from visions or hallucinations. This edition explores the notion that the forces of inspiration the ancients attributed to the gods actually emanated from an otherworldly source.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four bladesmiths must forge a fully functional serrated knife using steel from hand scissors, or risk getting cut from the competition.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Bogart tries to get his father in shape in time for his wedding. Meanwhile, Roy brings a mime to an auction in Corktown.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: The buyers have high hopes for a container auction in a town named Utopia, but it remains to be seen whether they will uncover any household treasures worth celebrating.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz explore a warehouse belonging to country musician Mickey Gilley, and find a sign used in the movie Urban Cowboy.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank examine petrol station advertising and memorabilia, and stumble on an exciting piece of motoring history.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank spend a large sum of money on cars, bikes and vintage advertising material in Michigan, but it remains to be seen if they can make a profit on their purchases.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The duo find a valuable collection of vintage toys in Iowa, while Mike is inspired to take a gamble on an unusual item.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick tries to persuade his father to buy a helicopter, before checking a 240-year-old lottery ticket that may have been signed by George Washington.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers assess the value of a spoon made by silversmith and American Revolution patriot Paul Revere, a cuckoo clock from the 1800s and a mysterious vintage archery bow.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers get the chance to buy a piece of American history when they assess the value of a Civil War sword. Plus, one of the country's rarest motorbikes is brought to the shop.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers study a pocket-sized sundial that conceals an interesting secret, and Corey and Chumlee hope to get their hands on a rifle-shooting arcade game from the 1960s.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick struggles to get a good deal for a flame-thrower, while Corey and Chumlee head to an auction to bid for a classic gypsy fortune-telling machine.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers examine an explosive set of Soviet nuclear missile launch keys and a 1920s Gibson ukulele banjo. Rick Harrison also encounters two of the biggest guns he has ever seen.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers get the opportunity to buy one of the quietest aircraft ever made. They also consider purchasing a famous casino chip called 'the one arm bandit' and a signed New York Yankees jersey.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers get the opportunity to purchase a Grammy trophy and a rare 1930s cola cooler. Later, a couple bring along a rickshaw that used to carry tigers in the Siegfried & Roy stage show.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers deliberate over a 1964 Austin Healey, a 2006 NBA Championship ring and a rare diving helmet from the 1800s.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers get lucky when a pirate's peg leg is brought into the shop. Rich gets the chance to buy a top-quality archery bow, and a man arrives with a full-sized wooden motorcycle.

programme.title: Irish Pickers
programme.desc: Ian and Butzy cross the Irish Sea to the north of England, where destinations include Manchester United's Old Trafford, the home of one of Ireland's sporting greats - George Best.

programme.title: Paranormal: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: An Oregon man shoots some incredible Bigfoot footage, UFOs gather over Texas and an active poltergeist appears in Wales.

programme.title: The Lowe Files
programme.desc: Actor Rob Lowe and his family investigate more strange phenomena, this time travelling up to the Redwood Forest to visit the Hoopa Indian Reservation, a hotspot for sightings of Sasquatch, a creature also known as Bigfoot.

programme.title: The Lowe Files
programme.desc: From the paranormal to the extraterrestrial to mysteries, legend and lore, actor Rob Lowe and his family reflect back on their adventures.

programme.title: Billion Dollar Wreck
programme.desc: Martin Bayerle attempts to prove the existence of the sunken treasure by hitting the books and following a historic Russian money trail.

programme.title: Knightfall
programme.desc: Landry continues his training in the Knights Templar Order under the harsh guidance of Talus, the battle-hardened Initiate master. De Nogaret implores King Philip to build a legal case against the Knights. Tom Cullen and Julian Ovenden star.

programme.title: Judge Romesh
programme.desc: Paul Danan finally gets his day in court with Shaun Williamson after a pantomime-based fallout, while a husband is sick and tired of his miserly wife ruining Christmas.

programme.title: Judge Romesh
programme.desc: A desperate father begs Judge Romesh not to let his son run off to the circus and a mother is sick and tired of her daughter bringing 'bad juju' into the house.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show in which two teams of celebs try to call each other's bluff with a few stories about themselves that might be true or might be out-and-out porkies. Joining team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are EastEnders star June Brown, comedians Aisling Bea and Seann Walsh, and football presenter Adrian Chiles.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Guests Lucy Porter, Frankie Boyle and Ross Noble join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig to contemplate the theme 'next' in this extended episode. As usual, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window in this quiz, in which the questions are so difficult points are awarded for the answers its questionmaster finds most interesting.

programme.title: Insert Name Here
programme.desc: Wildlife expert Chris Packham, actor Paul Feig, comedian Jon Richardson and historian Kate Williams join host Sue Perkins and captains Richard Osman and Josh Widdicombe on the comedy panel show. In this edition, the two sides answer questions about famous people past and present who share the name Ben, with the winners earning the right to pick the greatest bearer of the moniker - prompting comic banter, funny facts and unusual stats as the teams vie to outdo each other.

programme.title: Sliced
programme.desc: Joshua plucks up the courage to ask Naomi out, only to find she's already lined up another date. Ricky's plan to save the day backfires and Mario has a big date of his own to go on.

programme.title: Judge Romesh
programme.desc: Paul Danan finally gets his day in court with Shaun Williamson after a pantomime-based fallout, while a husband is sick and tired of his miserly wife ruining Christmas.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Beat the Internet with John Robins
programme.desc: The comedian hosts as members of the public are pitted against each other in a quest to predict how search engines respond to a series of questions.

programme.title: Beat the Internet with John Robins
programme.desc: The comedian hosts as members of the public are pitted against each other in a quest to predict how search engines respond to a series of questions.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May are each challenged to find a classic car at auction for Â£3,000. Exploring whether they are more fun to drive than modern alternatives, the trio then take the vehicles to Majorca to compete in a rally. Jeremy also test-drives the BMW Z4 and Nissan 370Z, and AC/DC frontman Brian Johnson is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The connoisseur of local food takes a gastronomic tour along the canal systems of southern France, from Bordeaux to Marseille. He samples seafood and regional cuisine, as well as exploring a variety of traditional recipes, including artichoke salad with poached egg, eels in cider, and bass with beurre blanc.

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The connoisseur of local food explores the banks of the River Garonne on board a 100-year-old converted barge, and savours the delights of French provincial cooking including magret de canard and petit sale. Other dishes featured are clams in white garlic sauce, eels in parsley and garlic butter, and steak tartare.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: In Louisiana, Danielle calls the shots from HQ when the guys find themselves in over their heads, and Frank strikes a side deal that leaves a permanent mark.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank finally get access to their white whale pick, while in Texas, the guys meet a collector who has filled an entire town with his mammoth stockpile.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: US host Sean Kelly oversees bidders in Lewes battling to win potential treasures found in storage containers, lock-ups and garages.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: US host Sean Kelly oversees UK bidders battling to win potential treasures found in storage containers, lock-ups and garages.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: US host Sean Kelly oversees UK bidders battling to win potential treasures found in storage containers, lock-ups and garages in Northumberland.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Host Sean Kelly oversees UK bidders battling to win potential treasures found in Nottingham's storage containers, lock-ups and garages.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: In Houston, Eddie faces the 'grim reaper' in a crawfish challenge featuring the fearsome reaper pepper. He also devours some southern comfort food and pulls a plane down a runway.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie Hall follows in Rocky's footsteps with physical challenges at a famed Philadelphia boxing gym - and his very own hunger games in the infamous Philly Cheesesteak Challenge.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: People forced out of their homes in Honduras by the notorious MS-13 gang plead their case for asylum in America. Officers discover 3,000lb of marijuana hidden in a cargo truck.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May are in Russia as the motoring magazine returns, taking part in a race across the urban landscape of St Petersburg. James defends the honour of the car in a very small Renault, Richard tries to prove that pedalling is faster by riding a bicycle, while Jeremy attempts to demonstrate that water is the quickest way across town by piloting a hovercraft. To make matters more complicated, all three presenters are racing not only one another but also the Stig, who is making his way toward the finish line by public transport. Plus, the new Lamborghini Huracan is put through its paces and singer-songwriter Ed Sheeran takes to the test track in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The presenters embark on a road trip across Australia's Northern Territory in fast, luxurious GT cars, with Jeremy Clarkson choosing a BMW M6 Gran Coupe, Richard Hammond picking a Bentley Continental GT V8 and James May opting for a Nissan GT-R. The trio set out on an adventure that takes in crocodile-infested rivers, a race around a vast opencast mine and an encounter with one of the world's longest lorries, concluding with an unusual challenge involving a farm, their cars and 4,000 cows. Plus, 24 star Kiefer Sutherland takes to the track in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner presents the comedy panel show, which sees chef and MasterChef judge John Torode, comedian Russell Howard and actress Katherine Parkinson compete to have their pet hates banished for ever. Their gripes include massive pepper grinders, grumpy kids and DJs who join in at the end of a song.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites comedy actress Catherine Tate, X Factor contender-turned-television host Rylan Clark-Neal and veteran actor Nigel Havers to vent their spleen about people and objects that upset them. Their gripes include hipster restaurants, set-up paparazzi shoots and Labour Party leader Jeremy Corbyn.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites comedian David Mitchell, tennis coach Judy Murray and Countryfile presenter Anita Rani to vent their spleen about people and objects that upset them. Their gripes include sniffing, walking and eating, and sugar lumps.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy accidentally runs over a pet rabbit belonging to the daughter of an important client, so she needs someone to help cover her tracks. Unfortunately, the best people she has are Lee and Daisy. Comedy, starring Lee Mack, Sally Bretton and Katy Wix.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee, Lucy and Daisy go on a skiing trip to Eastern Europe, but as usual disaster isn't far behind. The trio of friends find themselves stuck in a cable car with a handful of other nervous tourists - one of whom just happens to be pregnant. Comedy, starring Lee Mack, Sally Bretton and Katy Wix.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy becomes a relationship counsellor, so Lee and his father take advantage of her new-found skills in an effort to patch things up between them. Can they finally forgive and forget? Bobby Ball guest stars as Frank, with Lee Mack, Sally Bretton and Katy Wix.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Loyiso Gola, Milton Jones, Miles Jupp, Ellie Taylor and Josh Widdicombe join host Dara O Briain and regular Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the week's events through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Rob Beckett, Ed Gamble, Milton Jones, Romesh Ranganathan and Tiff Stevenson join host Dara O Briain and regular Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the week's events through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation. First aired in September 2016.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Terms and Conditions Apply
programme.sub-title: Shot Through the Face with a Canon
programme.desc: Using his trademark, powerpoint-comedy and mischievous games, Dave invites Katherine Ryan, Suzi Ruffell and Rufus Hound to help him make sense of our insensible world.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Series exploring ruined engineering projects that have been put to alternative use, including the site of the Chernobyl disaster and a Nazi holiday complex.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: How the world's biggest ship, designed to install oil platforms and lay pipelines, was inspired by a logging machine, a wire rope and 1940s shipbuilding techniques.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How the morale of the Third Reich, boosted by Germany's initial military successes, was shattered by the devastating defeat at Stalingrad, relentless Allied bombing raids and an attempt on Hitler's life. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Neil Oliver meets historian Collum MacNeil on the deserted island of Mingulay, and discovers why it was abandoned in 1912 after 2,000 years of habitation. Miranda Krestovnikoff learns the truth behind the classic Ealing comedy Whisky Galore! on Eriskay, and chemist Mike Bullivant tries to recreate a 19th-century experiment to turn peaty soil into oil.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Neil Oliver admires ginger seals at Walton-on-the-Naze, while Nick Crane examines the area's fossil record. Miranda Krestovnikoff explores research into the thornback ray on the Thames Estuary and how it aids conservation. The team also visits Felixstowe, the UK's busiest container port, where HM Revenue and Customs uncover a stash of cocaine smuggled among furniture.

programme.title: Deadliest Crash: Disaster at Le Mans
programme.desc: Documentary examining what caused Pierre Levegh's Mercedes to crash into the crowd during the 1955 Le Mans 24-hour race, killing more than 80 people - an accident that remains the worst in the history of motor racing. Among the theories discussed are the use of untested technologies by the car's manufacturers, the addition of a lethal fuel additive and allegations of reckless driving by future Formula One world champion Mike Hawthorn, who won the race with Jaguar team partner Ivor Bueb. Narrated by Jack Deam.

programme.title: Nazi Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: The theories surrounding the death of Hermann Goering, who managed to cheat the hangman by taking a cyanide capsule on the day before his scheduled death.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Heavy haulage experts Ian Bagladi and Jamie Turnbull need to move a classical but abandoned 63-year-old, 70-tonne locomotive, through the English countryside.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A widow reluctantly parts with her husband's treasured collection of Rolls Royces and Bentleys, and an impulse buyer finds one of the cars a new home.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of a car auction business. A near-perfect 50s Chevy panel van and a very desirable low-mileage 80s Brooklands Capri tempt auctioneer Derek out of Yorkshire.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: The team struggles to explain how a DAF 33 gearbox works, and office manager Sarah attempts to bring order to the auto memorabilia sale.

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: Following the wildlife that inhabits the famous American national park, a lost world of deep forests, vast plains and bubbling geysers. The first episode focuses on a variety of species as they struggle to survive the rigours of a freezing six-month winter, revealing that although the herds of elk and bison are weakened by the cold, one animal gets stronger - the wolf.

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: Summer returns, transforming the landscape of the famous national park from a frozen wilderness into the ideal environment for newborn animals. As temperatures rise, grizzly bears teach their young the secrets of survival - but even at this time of year, snow can sweep down from the mountains without warning.

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: An early dusting of snow signals the end of autumn, a time when the forests are a blaze of red and gold and the animals prepare for the coming cold. The elk face hungry wolves as they move down from the mountains to feed in the valleys, while beavers rush to defend their habitat against the destructive ice, repairing dams and stocking underwater larders before the waters freeze over.

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: Following the wildlife that inhabits the famous American national park, a lost world of deep forests, vast plains and bubbling geysers. The first episode focuses on a variety of species as they struggle to survive the rigours of a freezing six-month winter, revealing that although the herds of elk and bison are weakened by the cold, one animal gets stronger - the wolf.

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: Summer returns, transforming the landscape of the famous national park from a frozen wilderness into the ideal environment for newborn animals. As temperatures rise, grizzly bears teach their young the secrets of survival - but even at this time of year, snow can sweep down from the mountains without warning.

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: An early dusting of snow signals the end of autumn, a time when the forests are a blaze of red and gold and the animals prepare for the coming cold. The elk face hungry wolves as they move down from the mountains to feed in the valleys, while beavers rush to defend their habitat against the destructive ice, repairing dams and stocking underwater larders before the waters freeze over.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: Folk performances by artists including Pete Seeger, Tim Buckley, Joan Baez, Bob Dylan and Leonard Cohen.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: Music from the Top of the Pops archives, featuring performances by acts including the Foundations, Procol Harum, the Bee Gees, the Rolling Stones, and Dave Dee, Dozy, Beaky, Mick and Tich.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: Music from the flower power era, featuring bands including Herman's Hermits, the Crazy World of Arthur Brown, the Alan Price Set, Manfred Mann and the Rolling Stones.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: Archive clips featuring solo artists, including music by performers as diverse as Sandie Shaw, Dusty Springfield, Long John Baldry, Lulu, Tom Jones, Brenton Wood, Cliff Richard, Cilla Black and Peter Sarstedt.

programme.title: Princess Margaret: The Rebel Royal
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary profile of the Queen's sister, whose life and loves reflected the social and sexual revolution that transformed Britain during the 20th century. With archive footage and interviews, the series follows Margaret's life as she redefined the image of the modern princess, and begins with her birth in 1930. The abdication of her uncle propelled Margaret to second in line to the throne, but her life would be shaped by dramatic social change as Britain entered a more egalitarian era after the Second World War.

programme.title: The Queen's Castle
programme.desc: Documentary chronicling a year in the existence of 1,000-year-old Windsor Castle and its inhabitants, from the housekeeper and chefs to the Queen herself, who has allowed her public and private life to be documented more extensively than ever before. The state visit of former President of France Jacques Chirac sees the staff organise a banquet and a performance of a West End musical inside the building - but protesters outside threaten to mar proceedings.

programme.title: The Architecture The Railways Built
programme.desc: Tim Dunn explores the disused tube station Down Street in Mayfair, that played a crucial tactical role during the Second World War, and tours Rotterdam's new Centraal station with the man who designed it.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Boyd learns he is being removed from the Cold Case unit. For his final job, he re-opens an investigation into the disappearance of 16 homeless teenagers between 1979 and 1982 - the first case he ever worked on. However, as the team struggles to find any new information, Grace worries about her colleague's reasons for revisiting his past - while a guilt-ridden Sarah becomes desperate to make amends for her role in Boyd's sacking. Sarring Trevor Eve, with Paul McGann.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: A pretender to the throne is held captive at court, confounding the Tudors, and creating a new rift in Lizzie and King Henry's marriage. Lizzie faces an impossible choice, and makes a risky move to try to eliminate the threat to her family. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: The pretender exposes King Henry's weaknesses, while Lizzie confronts new demons and old curses. Concluding the sequel to The White Queen, set in the Middle Ages as the War of the Roses comes to an end. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: Dr Napier is intrigued by an ex-colonial couple recently returned from India who settle in Tannochbrae and refuse to have contact with their mysterious daughter. Starring David Rintoul, Ian Bannen and Annette Crosbie.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: Janet's maternal instincts are aroused by the discovery of a day-old baby abandoned on the doorstep of Arden House. Medical drama, with Annette Crosbie and David Rintoul.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: A flag from the American War of Independence turns up in a local church and triggers a wave of public interest as a number of villagers come forward to claim it as their own. Light-hearted drama, starring Ian McShane and Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish dealer tries to beat Charlie Gimbert to a priceless collection of Jewish antiques that has turned up in Essex. Alfred Marks guest stars with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Sean Bean returns as Bernard Cornwell's swashbuckling hero, this time setting out to rescue British deserters captured by Spanish rebel El Casco. Along the way he crosses swords with a fellow officer and come to the aid of a damsel in distress. Daragh O'Malley, Hugh Fraser and John Tams also star.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Oz is forced to take radical action to ensure the boys do not come out of the bridge job penniless, but it seems unlikely that his unique brand of sexual charm will save the day - and his doubts about son Rod's masculinity do not do much to help his focus. Just as they seem doomed to fail, a mysterious stranger arrives. Dick Clement and Ian La Frenais's comedy drama, with Tim Healy, Jimmy Nail and Timothy Spall.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Joe Saugus throws the lads a monetary lifeline, offering to buy the transporter bridge on behalf of his people, while Barry has a final showdown with Kadi and Tatiana. Believing their financial worries are finally over, the lads set off to oversee the construction process in Arizona - where a hostile reception awaits them. Timothy Spall, Jimmy Nail, Tim Healy and Bill Nighy star.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Laura and Rosemary are hired to create a restaurant garden on Italy's Ligurian coast, but it is not long before their working holiday is disrupted by a murder. Determined to solve the crime before returning home, they find themselves with no shortage of suspects - and matters are complicated further by a second death. Guest starring Suzanne Bertish (Rome) and Tristan Gemmill (Casualty), with Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: An archaeologist posing as Rosemary dies mysteriously during a dig for Anglo-Saxon artefacts in the grounds of Lord Engleton's stately home, presenting the duo with a fresh mystery to solve. The gardens are unaccountably blighted by yellowing, forcing the estate to close its gates to the public, and a second death suggests somebody will go to any lengths for a piece of British history. Guest starring Julian Wadham.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Laura and Rosemary are called in to investigate when gardens entered for a village contest are attacked by a disease. Further sinister undercurrents are exposed when reigning champion Donald Westward is found dead and recriminations start to fly as buried rivalries come to the surface. Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris star.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: Alzheimer sufferer Edward Alderston comes under suspicion of involvement when an ex-finance company high-flyer responsible for the loss of many elderly people's life savings is found floating in a swimming pool with a samurai sword in his back.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: A series of murders occurs after Murdoch and Ogden's book is released, prompting a desperate search for the copycat killer.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: After a 10-year-old girl is injured in a petrol bomb attack by animal rights activists, an outraged Gene takes Alex to interview a veteran campaigner in jail. Though the prisoner is weak and incoherent after going on hunger strike, Alex is convinced he not only has details of planned attacks - he may also know about her own situation and be able to help her get home. Guest starring David Bradley and Rory Kinnear.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: Gene receives a visit from Jackie Queen, a journalist from Manchester, who announces to the shocked superintendent she is pregnant with his baby. She is also investigating the disappearance of teenagers suspected of running away to London, so the team launches an investigation and a suspect is quickly identified. However, it becomes clear the man is being protected by someone within the Met. John Bowe and Ruth Millar guest star.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: A family GP is accused of murdering his wife, and Kavanagh, back in chambers following compassionate leave, is assigned to his defence. As the trial progresses, the battling barrister gradually comes to realise just how much he has in common with his client. Also starring Tom Courtenay, Oliver Ford Davies, Nicholas Jones and Valerie Edmond.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Sky News
programme.desc: A summary of the latest news headlines.

programme.title: Ian King Live
programme.desc: All the day's business news live from Sky's City of London studio, with Ian King.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Mission Employable
programme.desc: Agent Kym's next mission takes her to a fire station where she walks in the shoes of the brave firefighters there.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz tests a ray that makes people dance. Magoo, wearing a snorkelling mask he's convinced is a virtual reality gaming headset, mistakes the ray for a weapon..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Thinking he's on an Arctic expedition while actually at the beach, Magoo mistakes Fizz for a monkey, definitive evidence of global warming..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Thinking he's fixing Weasel's coffee maker, Magoo tweaks Fizz's teleporter, the invention that the hamster plans to exhibit at the innovation tradeshow..

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Louise snaps a photo of Mike while they play a game together. The only problem is that Mike looks absolutely ridiculous in it.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: The turtles organize a sports contest and whoever wins gets a special trophy. Iris volunteers a reluctant Mike to take part in the games.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: A local archaeology dig inspires Mr Bean to go hunting for treasure.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The hapless buffoon gets a liking for painting. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: After traveling to Tampa Beach, Florida, Team Tennyson hopes to get some much-needed rest & relaxation.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Summer rears its hot, cheeky head in Grimsby but Dave has found a way to keep the Spud flat nice and cool. Maybe too cool..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Dave demands to go on a foreign exchange. He soon finds himself headed for a week-long stay in a flat a few doors down..

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: Highlights from the series, including recipes from chefs Parveen Ashraf, Lisa Goodwin Allen and Ryan and Liam Simpson Trotman. James also prepares quiche, sticky toffee roulade and toad in the hole for Al Murray and looks back on a trip to Yorkshire.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott continues his tour of the Moroccan city of Marrakesh, beginning with a pottery lesson from a man who has been making pots for more than 50 years. He also hits the souks in search of local pastries, reveals the secret of a perfect cup of mint tea and learns how to prepare a classic tanjia, which is taken to be cooked in the fire of a neighbourhood hammam. Along the way he cooks harissa and preserved lemon chicken skewers, and tagine.

programme.title: How to Keep Your Dog Happy at Home
programme.desc: Advice on looking after dogs during lockdown, when they find themselves spending more time than ever in their owners' company but are limited in their options for going for a walk. In the first episode, a rescue border collie learns some energy-burning tricks from its owner, Ben Fogle and Gabby Logan offer tips on ensuring your pets stay fit. Ben tries out canine yoga with his labrador Storm, while Gaby finds her boxer's talent for jumping may help him get exercise in the garden.

programme.title: The Village
programme.desc: Documentary charting a year in the life of Portmeirion, the setting for ITV's cult 1960s drama The Prisoner, beginning by get to know the men and women who are the guardians of this Italianate village on the Gwynedd coast.

programme.title: You've Been Framed!
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates a comical selection of mishaps filmed by viewers. Featuring a gender reveal that goes wrong, a canine selfie, and a wedding only Star Wars fans were invited to.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show, asking contestants Jane, Adrian and Laura to 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win Â£50,000

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five friends calling themselves the Science Alliance answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Game show, hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard invites McFly's Danny Jones, Made in Chelsea star Georgia 'Toff' Toffolo and Coronation Street's Lisa George to take part in a special edition of the quiz show, answering questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the better their chances of collecting the Â£20,000 prize for their selected charity.

programme.title: ITV Football Classics
programme.sub-title: 1987 FA Cup Final: Coventry v Tottenham - ITV Football Classics
programme.desc: Coventry City v Tottenham Hotspur. Ian St John and Jimmy Greaves hosted coverage of the 1987 FA Cup final at the old Wembley Stadium, which proved to be one of the most memorable showpiece matches in the competition's history. With an introduction by Gabriel Clarke and commentary from Brian Moore.

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in this obstacle-course challenge, with celebrity contestants including professional skater Sylvain Longchambon, singer Joe McElderry, and Olympian snowboarder Aimee Fuller competing alongside members of the public. Hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara.

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: In this edition, Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show from Liverpool, setting members of the public unusual challenges for a chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to Â£1,000 in the big finale game.

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the 14th series of nationwide talent search, which sees a wide variety of acts, from comedians to contortionists, singers to spoon players, compete for the chance to win Â£250,000 and a coveted slot at the Royal Variety Performance. Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and David Walliams are once again on hand to judge this week's applicants, and each of them has the chance to put their favourite contestant straight through to the live semi-finals by awarding them the Golden Buzzer.

programme.title: Through the Keyhole
programme.desc: Comedian Jimmy Carr, TV and radio presenter Eamonn Holmes, and former Gogglebox star Scarlett Moffatt form the celebrity panel, Keith Lemon ventures into the homes of three more mystery stars. Once inside, he points out telltale clues that might hint at the identity of each property's occupant, and challenges his studio panellists to guess 'who habitates in a house like this?'.

programme.title: Ride Along (2014)
programme.desc: A wannabe police officer persuades his girlfriend's tough detective brother to take him along on duty. The cop hopes to scare his unwanted partner away from his sister by exposing him to danger - but needs some help when the patrol leads to a run-in with the city's most wanted criminal. Comedy, starring Ice Cube, Kevin Hart and Laurence Fishburne.

programme.title: Just Dance! Friday Night Party
programme.desc: We're embracing our inner Lady Gaga and getting ready to dance our Friday night away with the ultimate party anthems.

programme.title: Late Night Magic
programme.desc: We're taking you all the way through the night with soem of the best tracks of all time.

programme.title: Relight The 90s
programme.desc: We are bringing you straight back to the 90's! With all of the biggest and best tunes.

programme.title: Every Number 1 Of The 80s
programme.desc: Mark Goodier introduces a musical marathon through every chart-topping record of the 90s.

programme.title: Relight The 90s
programme.desc: We are bringing you straight back to the 90's! With all of the biggest and best tunes.

programme.title: 911's Ultimate 90's Party
programme.desc: We're going back to the gelled hair and camo pants of the nineties thanks to Jimmy from 911. Expect tracks from S Club, Kylie and Take That.

programme.title: Don't Stop The 90s Party! Top 50

programme.desc: Let the world sleep! But here at Kiss we are still up, still delivering the finest beats for your nocturnal jam.

programme.desc: We've got all the hits that are storming the charts right now, along with some brand new releases from your favourite and new artists.

programme.title: Big Weekend Anthems
programme.desc: We make it to the weekend and now it's time to celebrate with some huge hits from your favourite stars.

programme.title: That's My Jam! Freakin' US Beats
programme.sub-title: That's My Jam! Freakin' US Beats: Top 50
programme.desc: World-famous DJ Shortee Blitz salutes our American cousins with his playlist of brilliant US beats. Get your freak on to the likes of Fifth Harmony, Will.I.Am, Usher and Beyonce.

programme.title: The Saturday Hotmix!
programme.desc: An exclusive, non-stop mix of the hottest songs to soundtrack your Saturday evening!.

programme.title: All The Hits, All Night
programme.desc: Non-stop hits to see you all the way through the night.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: Exploring how fish are farmed, raw cane is turned into sugar, and suits are tailored in just one day.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer buys an old Lancia Delta Integrale, enlisting Edd China to fix the brakes and change the battery.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China completes his work on the Lancia Delta Integrale, and Mike Brewer has no trouble in finding an eager buyer for the newly restored classic car.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: At Biggin Hill, south-east London, military equipment collector Bruce Crompton views a collector's haul of Second World War Spitfires. Plus, the twins prepare some wartime artillery guns to export to Australia - but it's no easy feat.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Mikey attends the opening of his art gallery, OCC works on a build for Supernatural Cymbals and Paul Jr deals with a lawsuit from his father.

programme.title: World's Top 5
programme.desc: A countdown of some of the world's most powerful vehicles, including the Bugatti Veyron and Thrust SSC, which secured the world land speed record after reaching 763mph in 1997.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Intrepid host Mike Rowe takes on his latest challenge, travelling to Utah to take on the surprisingly dirty job of being a palaeontologist.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Custom Knee Braces/Ductless Air Conditioners/Window Film/Motorcycle Exhaust Systems
programme.desc: The development and production of custom knee braces, ductless air conditioners, window film and motorcycle exhaust systems.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Solid State Drives/Eye Shadow/Limousines/Dead Blow Hammers
programme.desc: The manufacturing processes behind the production of solid state drives, eye shadow, limousines and dead blow hammers.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Superbowl fever hits The Cornelia Marie, an injured crewman causes problems on the Wizard, the Cape Caution makes an almost fatal error, while the Time Bandit loses a Captain.

programme.title: Devonport: Inside the Royal Navy
programme.desc: Captain Anderson oversees a test of a 4.5 inch gun on HMS Sutherland, the most modern Frigate in the Royal Navy. Meanwhile, marriage and departures leave an emotional strain.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. As Edd China completes the BMW 635CSi renovation project, Mike Brewer values the vehicle and goes looking for a potential buyer.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. As Edd China completes the BMW 635CSi renovation project, Mike Brewer values the vehicle and goes looking for a potential buyer.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer enlists the help of mechanic Edd China to make a 1980s BMW 325i Touring roadworthy once more.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mechanic Edd China finishes off the BMW's suspension and wheel bearings, before handing the car over to Mike Brewer, who tries to sell it for profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer is pleased to buy a V8-engined BMW 840 coupe - but when mechanic Edd China sees the condition it is in, he struggles to muster the same enthusiasm.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys a cheap BMW M5 in a terrible condition, and Edd China has his work cut out trying to rejuvenate the dilapidated vehicle so it can turn a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer is on the lookout for a two-seat roadster with attitude in the form of an original BMW Z1, which could make a tidy profit after Edd China works his magic.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer seeks to get his hands on an expensive BMW 2002tii, and if he is to stay on budget, he must take a gamble on a model that has not been started for 17 years.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer searches for a BMW M3 E36 that Edd China can restore to make a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China goes over budget to restore a BMW M3 E36, making it more difficult for Mike Brewer to achieve a profit when he sells it on.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer tracks down a BMW Isetta bubble car, but Edd China finds the small vehicle difficult to repair and the pair's chances of turning a profit are put in jeopardy.

programme.title: Swimming with Monsters with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: The naturalist joins forces with behavioural experts, scientists and extreme divers to swim with fascinating but deadly animals. His journey begins in Mexico, where he learns all about the great white shark. Leaving the safety of his dive cage, he hopes to be able to study the predator at close quarters.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Boulder Boys Aaron and Ron almost lose their $60,000 excavator on unstable ground. Off-the-grid opal hunting family The McFarlanes race a storm in Lightning Ridge.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Salesman Mike Brewer and mechanic Ant Anstead take on a 1987 Alfa Romeo Spider Quadrifoglio with a rare hard-top. The car needs extensive repairs, including a rebuild of the propshaft.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard and Paul Cowland leap at the chance to buy a rare pickup version of a mini, but the decision about what to do with the tatty canvas load cover causes some creative differences.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard heads to Devon, where he finds a wealth of unusual oddities housed in a country pub. He moves on to Hastings, East Sussex, which has enjoyed a recent resurgence in the antiques trade.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team tackle a badly water-damaged rosewood table, give a much-loved panda bear a makeover and restore a vintage toy steamboat.

programme.title: World's Greatest Motorcycle Rides
programme.desc: Part one of two. Starting in Auckland in the North Island, Henry Cole sets off on two wheels - but soon takes to air and sea - to witness more of the breathtaking scenery that New Zealand is justly famed for.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Boulder Boys Aaron and Ron almost lose their $60,000 excavator on unstable ground. Off-the-grid opal hunting family The McFarlanes race a storm in Lightning Ridge.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Heather's fiance acts like a drill sergeant when picking out dresses and the bride soon becomes frustrated with his bad attitude.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A woman's brash mother causes her bridesmaids to feel self-conscious in their dresses, giving consultant Nikky a lot of work to do.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown gets hands-on with an angry alligator, a dehydrated puppy struggles, Lucky the cat swallows a large amount of human medication and a parrot is involved in a love triangle.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Archie the Labrador suffers life-threatening shakes, a canine gets a fishing hook stuck in its mouth, a snake takes a dip in an old woman's pool and a walleroo requires help.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. Despite a solid support network of her boyfriend and cousin, Tiffany finds it difficult to break the cycle of depressed eating when her two room-mates refuse to help her.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part two of two. Cameras follow Tiffany, who finds it difficult to break the cycle of depressed eating.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Dottie loves being a mother but, at over 600lbs, she's on the verge of leaving her two young children motherless. Cameras witness her as she takes drastic action in a bid to turn her life around.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Randy's food addiction cost him his marriage and access to his daughter, so he endeavours to lose weight through surgery for her sake.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The story of Tim Carney, who vanished on his way to church for morning prayers. The mystery deepened when his car was later retrieved from the airport and his bank account found to have been almost emptied.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Nightclub worker Emily wants a sexy look for her big day, but her mother has more conservative ideas and tries to persuade her to tone it down a little.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Dana takes her two bridesmen to her appointment, while Akisha brings along her fiance's best man, hoping a male perspective will help her reach a decision.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Mackenzie knows exactly what she wants - a dress that makes her look like Jessica Rabbit, so consultant Britney tries to find the perfect item.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Dawn searches for a princess gown for her wedding, but cannot find anything that lives up to her standards.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Three brides, whose weddings are a celebration of life as well as love. Cheryl and Krisin have recently beaten cancer, and Jennifer is battling kidney disease.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Tanya takes her family with her to find a blush-coloured dress, but when they prove brutally honest in their opinions, it is left to the assistant to keep the peace.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride Katie wants a mermaid-style dress, but her mother would prefer to see her in a traditional ballgown. Consultant Jenny is left trying to find a compromise.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Broadway star Kristin Chenoweth helps her best friend to find a dress with glitz and glam, while two sets of sisters fail to agree on a style.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Reality show following Theresa Caputo, who alleges she can speak to the dead and tries to connect clients with their loved ones.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo encounters an unexpected guest at the dog groomers, aids an upset mother and becomes nervous while teaching her daughter how to drive.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo tries to find a way to help the alleged spirit of a six-year-old boy who refuses to leave her and is taking a serious emotional toll.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo helps two men connect with a friend who died suddenly. Meanwhile, her husband is tired of having to leave the house for clients.

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.desc: Charlotte is bubbly and friendly, but behind closed doors, her two-bed bungalow is so full her things pose a physical risk. Plus, her friends are fearing for her sanity.

programme.title: Evil Online
programme.desc: The 2011 death of Eddie Leal, a 23-year-old professional bantamweight boxer, who set out in the middle of the night to meet an attractive girl he met online, but was later found dead in his car. Edmundo Guzman Jr was convicted of using a images of a female model in a false Facebook account to lure men to their deaths, simply for the thrill of killing.

programme.title: I Survived Evil
programme.desc: Recounting how a night out in Detroit ended in horror when a young woman found herself stranded on the motorway with a violent gang.

programme.title: Serial Psyche
programme.desc: Experts and investigators examine the backgrounds of the world's most notorious serial killers to create a cognitive psychological profile and find out what made them kill.
